Package game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    It contains the representation of the game Board which uses an HashMap of Field indexes. Uses also two-dimensional HashMap of rows and columns. Board Fields are instances of the class Field.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Board​(int radius)
      Constructor which takes the radius as a parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board​(int radius)
        Constructor which takes the radius as a parameter. In our game we use constructor with radius==4 because that is size of the board for Abalone game. It is possible to make the Board smaller or bigger if user wants to adjust game preferences later on.
        Parameters:
        radius - Based on radius it creates the board of that size.

    • Method Detail

      • getFields

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​Field> getFields()
        Gets the HashMap of the fields which are creating board.
        Returns:
        Return HashMap of the fields which are creating board.

      • getField

        public Field getField​(java.lang.Integer x,
                      java.lang.Integer y)
        Gets the Field based on coordinate system from a two-dimensional map.
        Parameters:
        x - Coordinate x.
        y - Coordinate y.
        Returns:
        Returns the Field on the board.

      • getField

        public Field getField​(int index)
        Gets the Field based on index system from a map.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the Field.
        Returns:
        Returns the Field on the board.

      • setField

        public void setField​(int index,
                     Field field)
        Sets the Field based on index system.
        Parameters:
        index - Sets the field on index position on the Board.
        field - Object of class Field which replaces another Field previously located on index position.

      • setField

        public void setField​(java.lang.Integer x,
                     java.lang.Integer y,
                     Field field)
        Sets the Field based on coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        x - Coordinate x.
        y - Coordinate y.
        field - Field which will take place of another Field previously located on the x,y position.

      • updateField

        public void updateField​(int index,
                        Field field)
        Using previously defined methods for setting Field, updates the Field.
        Parameters:
        index - Takes an index and uses it to update current Field. (Coordinates not needed here)
        field - Takes a Field and replaces a Field previously located on index position.

      • createFields

        public void createFields()
        Creates all the Field on the Board using stored radius. Size of the board is depended on the radius instance variable.

      • addIndexes

        public void addIndexes()
        Combines indexes with coordinate system.

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(Move move)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Makes a Move on a board. If it is, invalid it throws exception. For every Marble located on a Field it makes previous position empty. For every Marble it checks if Marble is not pushed away from the board. If it is not it moves to new Field.
        Parameters:
        move - Instance of class Move. Responsible for a Move on a Board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Invalid move exception if move is not valid.

      • getUpperRight

        public Field getUpperRight​(Field field)
        Gets the Upper Right neighbour of the Field.
        Parameters:
        field - Field which is in centre.
        Returns:
        Field which is on upper right position from the argument field.

      • getRight

        public Field getRight​(Field field)
        Gets the Right neighbour of the Field.
        Parameters:
        field - Field which is in centre.
        Returns:
        Field which is on right position from the argument field.
